publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msItem.rubric:
Nomina sacra; name of the ruling King; headings and incipits of the constituent texts; directives for the ministers; some of the musical notation signs above the lines; most of the abbreviations; elements of decorated quire marks; elements of the punctuation signs and Ethiopic numbers.
The incipit pages of most of the constituent texts are written alternately in red and black lines (s. fols. 5r, 29r, 50v, 61rb, 64v, 75r, etc.).

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 158.0 folios, of which 13.0 blank, in 17.0 quires.
24.4 18.2 6.6
supportDesc.condition: Many leaves are stained with dirt.

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

decoNote.locus: Wide uncoloured ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text I, with a pair of ails on the top and interlaces and floral ornamentation motifs:
Wide uncoloured ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of the Mi mäṭän prayer, with a pair of ails on the top and interlaces and floral ornamentation motifs:
Wide uncoloured ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text III-1, with a pair of ails on the top, a palmette in the centre and interlaces and floral ornamentation motifs:
Narrow uncoloured ornamental band over col. b, at the incipit of text III-2, with interlaces and floral ornamentation motifs:
Wide uncoloured ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text III-3, with a pair of ails on the top and interlaces and floral ornamentation motifs:
Wide uncoloured ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text III-4, with a pair of ails on the top, a palmette in the centre and interlaces and floral ornamentation motifs:
Wide uncoloured ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text III-5, with interlaces and floral ornamentation motifs:
Wide uncoloured ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text III-6, with a pair of ails on the top and interlaces and floral ornamentation motifs:
Wide uncoloured ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text III-7, with a pair of ails on the top and interlaces and floral ornamentation motifs:
Wide uncoloured ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text III-8. Greater part of the band is very faded:
Wide uncoloured ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text III-9, with interlaces:
Wide uncoloured ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text III-10, with a pair of ails on the top and interlaces:
Wide uncoloured ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text III-11, with interlaces:
Two pairs of uncoloured lines, with an empty space between them, over the incipit of text III-12:
Pair of uncoloured lines over the incipit of text III-13:
Two pairs of uncoloured lines, with an empty space between them, over the incipit of text III-14:

locus.span: Fol. 3r: Exhortation to the brethren, incomplete.

q.span: [Fol. 4v]: This is a Missal of ras Sǝbḥat. He who stole it or erased (its text) shall be excommunicated by the authority of Peter and Paul, of the twelve apostles, of the seventy two disciples, of the three hundred and eighteen Orthodox (Fathers).

locus.span: Fol. 153ra-rb: Exhortation to commemorate the owner and his relatives.
Fol. 153rb: Names of some of the owner’s relatives (?).
Fol. 153rb: Scribe’s note on completing the writing.

q.span: [Fol. 153rb]: Praise be to the Father, and the Son, and the Holy Spirit, forever and ever, to Him who has enabled me to complete (this work) in safety and in peace. Amen.

locus.span: Fol. 153va-vb: Extensive ownership note and supplication for the souls of the persons mentioned.
Fol. 154ra-rb: Names of several persons with indications of kinship

list.item: - Crude notes: fols. 1r, 156r, 157r, 158v. - Crude notes in the upper margin: fols. 40r, 47r. - Crude notes in the bottom margin: fols. 41r, 45r. - Stamps of seals, beneath Additio 2 and between Additiones 4 and 5: fols. 4v, 153r. - Pen trial, in red ink: fol. 158r. - Pen trial, in black ink: fol. 158v.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with dark-brown leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Small holes and tears are visible on the spine folds of the quires, close to the head and the tail. The leather on the inner sides of the boards is reddish-brown.

origin.origDate: Fols. 11rb, 23va: Mǝnilǝk is mentioned as the ruling King. Fol. 121vb: Qerǝllos is mentioned as the Patriarch and Ṗeṭros as the Metropolitan (or bishop). Mǝnilǝk II was the Emperor of Ethiopia in 1889-1913, Cyril V was the Patriarch of Alexandria in 1874-1927, Ṗeṭros IV was the Metropolitan of Ethiopia in 1881-89, subsequently serving as the bishop of the northern territories.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: Kidanä Maryam (baptismal name of ras Sǝbḥat, mentioned in supplication formulas on fols. 50va, 61rb, 75ra, etc.).

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
